pageContext.claim: “Since I signed the STOP Act into law, our amazing Customs and Border Protection officers have stopped over six times more packages from reaching American doorsteps.”
pageContext.analysis: A White House fact sheet offers a more specific version of this claim: “CBP has stopped over six times more packages containing fentanyl thanks to the STOP Act included in last year’s opioid legislation.” CBP, however, was unable to produce data to validate this statistic. The law was only signed in late 2018, and one expert said in April the law has not been implemented yet, with the U.S. Postal Service missing deadlines to show progress: "There is no public indication that either of these deadlines were met, even as foreign fentanyl continues to drive tragic overdose deaths." Federal agencies only recently launched prize competition that rewards innovative solutions for helping law enforcement agencies cut off the supply of drugs such as fentanyl.
